title: Changing the value of a parameter in Angular 4
body:
I'm building a unit test in Angular 4 I want to be able to pass in a variable to my router (as if I was on a webpage and navigating to url/3 where 3 is the variable I'm referring to)

I have achieved this with the following

      { provide: ActivatedRoute, useValue: { 'params': Observable.from([{ 'id': 5}]) } },

What I want to achieve is, one test varifies that I query the proper database hit (through mocks) and that said object returns with ID 5

In another test, i want to ensure that my component is listening to URL events.

How do I go about 'emitting' a change in this ActivatedRoute parameter so in another test, i can write Parameter=10; expect returned object.id=10
